meanings.sent1: She felt luckies when she found money in her old jacket pocket.
meanings.sent2: The team considered themselves luckies to have won the championship.
meanings.sent3: Being luckies meant she always found the best parking spots.
meanings.sent4: His luckies nature seemed to attract good things to him effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The luckies student aced every test without studying much.

meanings.sent1: He bought a pack of luckies from the store on the corner.
meanings.sent2: Back in the day, people often smoked luckies at parties.
meanings.sent3: The old movie star always had a luckies cigarette in hand on set.
meanings.sent4: The detective found a clue in the ashtray - a crushed luckies cigarette.
meanings.sent5: The smell of luckies smoke lingered in the air of the dimly lit bar.

meanings.definition: a nickname for someone who is considered lucky
meanings.sent1: His friends called him Luckies because he always won at games.
meanings.sent2: She became known as Luckies after winning the lottery twice.
meanings.sent3: Luckies was the name they jokingly gave to their friend with all the good fortune.
meanings.sent4: At the casino, everyone wanted to be around Luckies for a chance at luck rubbing off.
meanings.sent5: Luckies was the perfect name for the girl who seemed to have everything go her way.
